intro: Boechera shortii, commonly known as the Sierra wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Boechera shortii typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
